projects.title: ShopList
projects.subtitle: Android
projects.description: The first Android application I ever created was a shopping list, and it was not very good in terms of code and design. Now that I know Android better I decided to recreate the shopping list application. Update 06.03.16: New functionality and a new theme. Will update more in the future.

projects.title: Event server
projects.subtitle: Node, MongoDB
projects.description: RESTful Node server for storing information about events. This API will be used for a cross-platform application later. MongoDB is used for storing. Will also write tests.

projects.title: SpeedRunsLive
projects.subtitle: Ionic
projects.description: This application will use the web API from speedrunslive.com to display information about speedruns from games. The webpage is not optimized for phones, so I thougth I could contribute to the community.

projects.title: Organisation Unit Manager
projects.subtitle: DHIS2 webapp
projects.description: This is a webapp that was made for the open source project DHIS2 in the open source course at UiO. The app use the DHIS2 web API to add and edit organistaion units. It also shows the location of a unit on a map.

projects.title: Streemer
projects.subtitle: Ionic
projects.description: Cross-platform application that collects multiple streaming websites in one application. I started this to learn Ionic, and it currently only has Twitch and Hitbox. It needs alot of improvements for it to be released, and I would probably start from scratch if I am ever going to release it.

projects.title: CloudComics
projects.subtitle: Ionic
projects.description: Cross-platform application that lets you read comic books(.cbr and .cbz format) from your cloud storage. The development of this app is currently on hold.

projects.title: SimCV
projects.subtitle: Android
projects.description: This is my bachelor thesis. It shows how the OpenCV library can be used together with the Android camera. Mostly Java, some C++.

projects.title: SimCV Game
projects.subtitle: Android
projects.description: This app was a part of my bachelor thesis. It is not a good game, but it helped us to show how OpenCV could be used together with LibGDX to make a game. You use the Android camera to track a specific color, this moves the player.

projects.title: pictureSort
projects.subtitle: Desktop app, C#
projects.description: Copies and sorts all the pictures in the Windows picture folder into a new folder. Pictures are sorted by date. Did this small project to test C#.

projects.title: Firestorm
projects.subtitle: Android, Raspberry PI, Go, Python
projects.description: Remote control for a gas fireplace, built with Raspberry Pi and Android. Raspberry Pi runs a Python or a Go http server, which responds to GET requests from a Android application.

projects.title: Photo  Viewer
projects.subtitle: Desktop client and server. Java
projects.description: A photo viewer client that connects to a server that serves the photos that the user has stored. Group project for the course software development at UiS. My responsibility was the database and the communication with it. We used hibernate for communication to a SQLite database.
